en: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Zophar Naamath mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a.

en: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, Even by reason of my haste that is in me.
hmr: “Chuleiin, ka ngaituonahai chun dawnna a mi pêk a nih, Keimaa inhmâwnatak um lei ngei chun.

en: I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame; And the spirit of my understanding answereth me.
hmr: Kâwkna mi sukzaktak el chu ka lo hriet tah a, Ka hrietthiemna thlarau chun a mi hung dawn tah a nih.

en: Knowest thou not this of old time, Since man was placed upon earth,
hmr: Tienlaia hi thil hi i hriet naw a ni maw, Mihriem chu hnuoi chunga sie a nia inthawk tah,

en: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the godless but for a moment?
hmr: Mi rilohai hnêna chu a tâwi hlak a, Pathien ngaisak lohai hlimna khawm chu mitkhapkâr chau a ni hlak ti hi?

en: Though his height mount up to the heavens, And his head reach unto the clouds;
hmr: A ṭhatna chu vân tawngin intieng sienla khawm, A lu chun sûmhai tawng sienla khawm,

en: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: They that have seen him shall say, Where is he?
hmr: Ama êk ang el chun la hung bohmang ngei a ta, Ama lo hmu hlaktuhai chun, ‘Khâwlai am a um tah a?’ tîng an tih.

en: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: Yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
hmr: Mang ang elin vuong hmang a ta, hmu ruol ni ta naw ni, Anih, Zâna mitthlaa thilhmuhai ang el chun hnawt hmang ni tâng a tih.

en: The eye which saw him shall see him no more; Neither shall his place any more behold him.
hmr: Mit ama lo hmu ta hlak khawm chun hmu ta naw nih a, Ama hmun khawm chun hmu ta ngai hrim hrim naw ni.

en: His children shall seek the favor of the poor, And his hands shall give back his wealth.
hmr: A thlahai chun mi rimsihai ditsakna chu zawng tâng an ta, A kuthai chun a hausakna chu pe kîr tâng a tih.

en: His bones are full of his youth, But it shall lie down with him in the dust.
hmr: A ruhai chu a tleirâwlnaa sip a na, Nisienlakhawm, ama leh pilvuta chun zâl tâng a tih.

en: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, Though he hide it under his tongue,
hmr: “Rîtlona chu a bauah thlum sien khawm, A lei hnuoia chun thup hlak sienla khawm;

en: Though he spare it, and will not let it go, But keep it still within his mouth;
hmr: Hla zingin, insuoktir hlek loin, A bau sûnga chun kawl zing ta sienla khawm;

en: Yet his food in his bowels is turned, It is the gall of asps within him.
hmr: A bu chu a rîlhai sûnga chun la hung inlet a ta, A sûnga chun rûl tûr hung ning a tih.

en: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again; God will cast them out of his belly.
hmr: Hausaknahai chu a dawl tah a, hung luok suok nâwk a tih, Pathien chun a phîng sûnga inthawkin hung pei suok a tih.

en: He shall suck the poison of asps: The viper’s tongue shall slay him.
hmr: Rûl tûr chu fâwp a ta, Rûlriel tûrin ama chu sukhlum a tih.

en: He shall not look upon the rivers, The flowing streams of honey and butter.
hmr: Vadunghai chu en ta ngai naw nih a, Nênetui khal le khuoizu tui luonghai chu.

en: That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down; According to the substance that he hath gotten, he shall not rejoice.
hmr: A sininrimna bêk bêk, ra chu pe kîr a ta, lem thla el naw ni, Thil a nei ang hu peiah ama chu hlim naw ni.

en: For he hath oppressed and forsaken the poor; He hath violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.
hmr: Mi rimsihai chu a nghatsanin, a nêksâwr a, In dâm chu a pâwng lâk a, a ibâwl naw khawm,

en: Because he knew no quietness within him, He shall not save aught of that wherein he delighteth.
hmr: A duâmna chun to ṭawk ṭawk hrim a hriet naw leiin, A lâwmna tak thil chu hmu bawk naw nih.

en: There was nothing left that he devoured not; Therefore his prosperity shall not endure.
hmr: A fâk zo naw dinga hla hrim thil a um nawh a, Chuleiin, a hausakna chun dai sâwt naw nih.

en: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: The hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon him.
hmr: A hau tâwk zet huna chun inrêkin um a ta, Mi rimsihai kut chu a chungah hung tlung a tih.

en: When he is about to fill his belly, God will cast the fierceness of his wrath upon him, And will rain it upon him while he is eating.
hmr: A phîng chu suksip ding a ni phingleh, Pathien chun a lungsen ṭiumna chu a chungah buok a ta, A fâk lai chun a chungah a sûrin sûr a tih.

en: He shall flee from the iron weapon, And the bow of brass shall strike him through.
hmr: Thîr hriemhreia inthawkin tlânsieng a ta, Dârsen thalngul chun ama kâp thleng a tih.

en: He draweth it forth, and it cometh out of his body; Yea, the glittering point cometh out of his gall: Terrors are upon him.
hmr: A hnûk dawk a, a taksaa inthawk chun a hung suok a; Anih, a hmawrzum tlê chu a mîtkhaa inthawkin a hung suok a, Ṭitumhai chu ama chunga chun a um a nih.

en: All darkness is laid up for his treasures: A fire not blown by man shall devour him; It shall consume that which is left in his tent.
hmr: Inthimna po po chu a rohai dingin siekhâwl a na; Mei, mihriem isêm loin kâng hmang a ta; A puon ina mâksan a la mahla khawm chu kâng hmang a tih.

en: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, And the earth shall rise up against him.
hmr: Vânhai chun a suolnahai chu suklang a ta, Hnuoi chun ama chunga chun do a tih.

en: The increase of his house shall depart; His goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
hmr: A in hlâwkna chun ama mâksan a ta, A lunginsen nia chun a thuomhnawhai chu luong hmang a tih.

en: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, And the heritage appointed unto him by God.
hmr: Hi hi Pathiena inthawka mi rilo chan chu a nih, Pathienin a rochan dinga a ruotpêk chu,” tiin.
